name: vscode-journal
description: Lightweight journal and simple notes support for Visual Studio Code

commands.title: Print elapsed hours between selected times
Print the sum of the selected numbers

configuration.title: Configuration for the Journal extension. Check the extension wiki for supported variables (as embedded expressions).

journal.base.description: (Mandatatory) The base directory for your notes. Defaults to the directory 'Journal' in your home directory. Supports embedded variables

journal.ext.description: The default extension of your notes and journal entries. Defaults to markdown (.md)-

journal.locale.description: The locale to use (required for the date format). Defaults to 'en-US'.

journal.patterns.description: Individual patterns which define where and how notes and entries are stored. Check the wiki for defaults and options.

journal.tpl-entry.description: The template string for your daily journal entries. Please edit directly in settings.json to include linebreaks.

journal.tpl-time.description: The template string for inserting the current time at the cursor location. Defaults to local time.

journal.tpl-note.description: The template string for your notes. This setting is outdated, please use the setting 'templates' instead

journal.tpl-memo.description: The template string for new memos (new lines). This setting is outdated, please use the setting 'templates' instead

journal.tpl-memo-after.description: Where to place new memos. (Default is empty, which means after the header). This setting is outdated, please use the setting 'templates' instead

journal.tpl-task.description: The template string for new tasks. This setting is outdated, please use the setting 'templates' instead

journal.tpl-task-after.description: Where to place the tasks. (Default is empty, which means after the header). This setting is outdated, please use the setting 'templates' instead

journal.tpl-todo.description: The template string for new todos. This setting is outdated, please use the setting 'templates' instead

journal.tpl-todo-after.description: Where to place the todos. (Default is empty, which means after the header). This setting is outdated, please use the setting 'templates' instead

journal.tpl-files.description: Template for the link to notes

journal.tpl-files-after.description: Where to place the file links to notes and more. (Default is empty, which means after the header). This setting is outdated, please use the setting 'templates' instead

journal.dev.description: If enabled, the features in development will be activated (other features might be broken!!)

journal.openInNewEditorGroup.description: If true, the journal pages and new notes will split the editor view.

journal.scopes.description: Define your own scopes here, see extension guide for more details.

journal.useLastScope.description: If enabled, will remember last used scope and use it as default.

journal.templates.description: Definition of templates used when generate content for the journal. See Guide for more details.
